messages.message: :wave: Howdy folks! I've been working on making our vscode configuration better, starting with Go in this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/67155) -- I've tested it out myself from both the local and web IDE, and would like to get some sanity checks from people who typically develop in Go :pray:  (cc <!subteam^S08AA13VAFQ>)
Nice! I'll peek at this later after some other items are handled :slightly_smiling_face:
Dude! Someone was asking me about this just the other day. I forget who.

Haha sounds like this came up at a good time then :slightly_smiling_face: I'm currently getting up to speed on the python extension and am thinking the overall layout is likely to change, but I think the config here should handle things nicely now for go
Just remembered -  @Sayan, Sean  is working on improving the VScode situation for go in crafting. I think you were having trouble with this?
Generally,yeah i wanted better linting and debugging than what I have locally. However, not sure who I talked to about it :lolcry:
Maybe it was someone else I talked toâ€¦hmm
@alex.zhou ^ you asked about crafting and vscode I think

Yea the serendipity of it all was interesting, because I was trying to overhaul my Neovim config to work with Bazel and Go on my own around the same time Sean was working on this, unbeknownst to either. :joy:

Does neovim by chance have any config auto-load special files? e.g. for vscode I'm looking at multi root workspaces (https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/multi-root-workspaces) which would let us lump the go settings together into code-workspace file at the root of the instabase repo

Hm, not in the same way probably, but there is likely a reasonable one-to-three liner that we could provide for inclusion in a user's personal `init.lua` that could point at a plugin directory alongside the vscode stuff in the repo root. It might require us to assume a specific plugin manager though, of which there are... many. :grimacing:

Also I suspect there are like 4 people who are stubborn enough to be using Neovim, and I'm one of them, so... :man-shrugging::skin-tone-3: :smile:
